quote_first:
“Hmm, let’s see. It’s a three-line rail-fence, a, d, g…d-a-r-l…Got it: ‘Darling Hepzibah’
Hepzibah? What kind of name is that?
‘Will meet you Reading Sunday
quote_last: train Didcot-Reading.’ Reading you all right, you idiots."
title: C
author: Tom McCarthy

quote_first: The next afternoon Mr. Underhill finished at the office early and took the three o'clock train, arriving out in Green Town at
quote_last: , in plenty of time to drink in the brisk rays of the autumnal sun.
title: The Playground
author: Ray Bradbury
